description.en: Nephrology is a branch of internal medicine dealing with the study of the function and diseases of the kidney. Nephrology concerns the diagnosis and treatment of kidney diseases, including electrolyte disturbances and hypertension, and the care of those requiring renal replacement therapy.
description.et: Nefroloogia moodustab ühe osa õppeainest “Sisehaigused” ja käsitleb neerude- ja kuseteede haiguste patogeneesimehhanisme, diagnostikat, ravi ja ennetust. Samuti ägeda ja kroonilise neerupuudulikkusega kaasnevaid elektrolüütide tasakaaluhäirete ravi ning neeruasendusravi.

objectives.en: The purpose of the course is to provide basic competency in the field of nephrology. Requirements for students are the following: to study of the function and diseases of the kidney, to obtain  principles of diagnostics and treatment of kidney diseases, including electrolyte disturbances and hypertension, and the care of those requiring renal replacement therapy.
objectives.et: Nefroloogia aine õpetamise eesmärk on saavutada üldised teadmised nefroloogia erialast tasemel, mis on vajalik töötamiseks arstina. Aine õpetamisel antakse ülevaade neerude ja kuseteede haigustest: nende etiopatogeneesi, diagnoosimise, ravi ja ennetuse kohta. Üliõpilane peab omandama teoreetilised alused haige käsitlusest ägeda ja kroonilise neerupuudulikkuse korral esinevatest elektrolüütide tasakaaluhäiretest ja neeruasendusravi võimalustest kaasajal.

learning_outcomes.en: After completion of the course the students will be able to:
1)	describe epidemiology, aetiology, pathogenesis, clinical symptoms of kidney diseases;
learning_outcomes.et: 1)	on omandanud teoreetilised teadmised neeruhaiguste epidemioloogiast, patogeneesist, diagnostikast ja ravi põhimõtetest;

learning_outcomes.en: 2)	demonstrate practical skills in acquiring a complete history and physical examination of patients with kidney diseases;
learning_outcomes.et: 2)	oskavad iseseisvalt küsitleda ja füüsikaliselt uurida haiget, kellel on neeruhaigus või kahtlus neeruhaigusele;

learning_outcomes.en: 3)	use for differential diagnosis laboratory and radiology techniques as well as to interpretate the data;
learning_outcomes.et: 3)	suudavad kasutada neeruhaiguste diagnoosimisel kasutatavaid laboratoorseid ja instrumentaalseid uurimisvõimalusi ning suudavad interpreteerida tulemusi;

learning_outcomes.en: 4)	describe management of patients with different clinical syndromes: proteinuria, hematuria, nephritic syndrome, nephrotic syndrome, rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis, acute kidney injury and chronic renal failure;
learning_outcomes.et: 4)	on võimelised teha diferentsiaaldiagnoosi ja käsitleda haigeid erinevate nefroloogilises praktikas esinevate sündroomide korral: proteinuuria, hematuuria, nefriitiline sündroom, nefrootiline sündroom, kiiresti progresseeruv glomerulonefriit, krooniline ja äge neerupuudulikkus;

learning_outcomes.en: 5)	estimate renal function and  to manage patient in different stage of chronic kidney disease;
learning_outcomes.et: 5)	oskavad hinnata neerufunktsiooni ning käsitleda kroonilise progresseeruva neeruhaigusega, diabeetilise või mittediabeetilise nefropaatiaga, haigeid erinevas staadiumis;

learning_outcomes.en: 6)	do treatment decisions for chronic kidney disease patients and to send patients in time to nephrologists for the start of renal replacement therapy;
learning_outcomes.et: 6)	oskavad teha põhjendatud raviotsuseid kroonilise neeruhaige ning õigeaegselt suunata haige edasi nefroloogile neeruasendusraviks.

learning_outcomes.en: 7)	know acute kidney injury signs and symptoms as well as treatment principles including necessity of renal replacement therapy.
learning_outcomes.et: 7)	tunnevad ära ja oskavad diferentsida ägeda neerupuudulikkuse põhjusi ja omandanud teoreetilised alused ägeda neerupuudulikkuse ravivõimaluste kohta.

description.et: A test result should be higher than 51 %.

grade_preconditions.et: Positive test result after practical works and seminars.

resources.mandatory_materials:
1. Textbook "Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine", 20th ed. 2018: 
Alterations in Renal and Urinary Tract Function; 
Disorders of the Kidney and Urinary Tract

2. Nephrology lectures 2019

Nephrology journals:

description.et:
Introduction. Presentation of patient and investigations. Symptoms and syndromes in nephrology. Chronic kidney disease (CKD), a definition, classification, main diseases that cause CKD. General management of CKD patients. Prof. M. Rosenberg
Pre-recorded video lecture.

Uraemia, Renal replacement therapy. Acute kidney injury. Prof. M. Rosenberg
Pre-recorded video lecture.
Introduction, diagnostics of kidney diseases, urinalysis, determination of GFR, kidney visualization. Uroinfection.
Proteinuria and nephotic syndrome. Diabetic nephropathy, amyloidosis, glomerulonephritis.
Acute kidney injury. Renal replacement therapy
